abstract.p: Three supervisors at Caleb Brett USA Inc, testing lab in Linden, NJ, plead guilty to fraud and conspiracy charges and company agrees to pay $1 million in federal fines for releasing substandard fuel to gasoline dealers in tri-state area (S)

block.p: A Linden testing lab agreed last week in federal court to pay $1 million in fines for releasing substandard fuel to gasoline dealers in the tri-state area. Three company supervisors pleaded guilty to fraud and conspiracy charges and face possible fines and jail time. By forging documents, Caleb Brett USA Inc. permitted nearly 300 million gallons of fuel that did not meet the Environmental Protection Agency's pollution standards to be sold throughout the tristate area, according to the Environment and Natural Resources division of the Justice Department.
